item.title: Tutorial Board post-moderation
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:62, topic:366916”][quote author=John459 link=topic=463111.msg3390603#msg3390603 date=1288892667]

The reality of it is, the negative outweighs the positive here. Less members will be motivated by the filter than members that don’t care if their tutorial gets passed.

Why not try it out for a week and see what the outcome is?
[/quote]I believe we had tried it for a long time…

But I think I read somewhere a suggestion of making a new sub-section for ‘approved’ or ‘good’ tutorials. Where mods can find the good tutorials and put them in there. I support that idea.[/quote]
Another for support on that one, as mods can do it at-will, and will require nobody new to do the job. Also, would be less complaining, as there would be a board specifically made for decent tuts.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Board post-moderation
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“John459, post:61, topic:366916”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=463111.msg3390349#msg3390349 date=1288844815]
The reality of it is, the negative outweighs the positive here. Less members will be motivated by the filter than members that don’t care if their tutorial gets passed.
[/quote]

Why not try it out for a week and see what the outcome is?[/quote]I believe we had tried it for a long time…

But I think I read somewhere a suggestion of making a new sub-section for ‘approved’ or ‘good’ tutorials. Where mods can find the good tutorials and put them in there. I support that idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Board post-moderation
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:57, topic:366916”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=463111.msg3390316#msg3390316 date=1288841207]
We did try it out, and the staff determined that it is better this way.
[/quote]
Hurr durr it didn’t get tried out before.[/quote]
Actually it was here, before MITB decided to switch and upgrade to SMF2.0. The mod was not available for SMF2.0 at the time, (might be now, idk), but after soo long of being without it, why decide to put it back? Sure, it would be nice for the people who actually look in there, but mods have enough work on their hands. Unless we promoted like 2 mods that live in different countries to do JUST tutorial approving, it wouldn’t be worth it. Lets just drop the topic, as this has been suggested many times, and never goes anywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Board post-moderation
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:57, topic:366916”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=463111.msg3390316#msg3390316 date=1288841207]
We did try it out, and the staff determined that it is better this way.
[/quote]
Hurr durr it didn’t get tried out before.[/quote]The tutorial board was moderated before. You just haven’t been here as long.

In a word, no.

We aren’t reverting back to filtering out topics. It was a thorn in the side of regular users, and a pain in the arse for the moderator team.

Read full topic

We did try it out, and the staff determined that it is better this way.

Lothy stated specifically that it will not be moderated again.

item.title: Tutorial Board post-moderation
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:54, topic:366916”][quote author=John459 link=topic=463111.msg3389744#msg3389744 date=1288805922]

It didn’t work last time; declined tutorials weren’t re-made

It doesn’t have to be the same tutorial that was declined. What I’m saying is that the next tutorial they release, whatever it may be, will be better than the previous one if the previous one was declined.
[/quote]

Adding onto this:

Even if someone writes a tutorial, gets it declined and doesn’t bother to write another due to laziness, then that person doesn’t deserve to be here. I can understand if they choose not to write another just because they feel they did their best in the previous one, however people who just half-ass tutorials are a waste of space.[/quote]

[quote=“Rixxx, post:49, topic:366916”]Progress of MoparScape vs. expected progress.
[size=99pt]← →[/size][/quote]
Why not just try it out? It wouldn’t hurt…

Read full topic

[/quote]

It doesn’t have to be the same tutorial that was declined. What I’m saying is that the next tutorial they release, whatever it may be, will be better than the previous one if the previous one was declined.[/quote]

Adding onto this:

Even if someone writes a tutorial, gets it declined and doesn’t bother to write another due to laziness, then that person doesn’t deserve to be here. I can understand if they choose not to write another just because they feel they did their best in the previous one, however people who just half-ass tutorials are a waste of space.

item.title: Tutorial Board post-moderation
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

The Reaper X:

Adding to what taharok said, moparscape overall as a community should be opensource. Open source throughout will only further advancement within the community. Were here to help one another, not deny one another.

It will stay the way it is with that mentality. Deny the ones who don’t want to learn, and reward the ones who make an effort. So give everyone an A for just posting some shit? Yeah, keep doing that and this place will still continue to be the way it is. Been that way since 2006, and will continue to be till something is done.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Board post-moderation
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:49, topic:366916”]Progress of MoparScape vs. expected progress.
[size=9pt]← →[/size][/quote]Where are you getting this information? :o

[quote=“John459, post:50, topic:366916”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=463111.msg3389417#msg3389417 date=1288759876]

Methinks the general point of a tutorial section is being missed. It’s a section of tutoring contributions of all forms. The second we started expecting more out of this community, the decreasing amount of contributions we got. I’ve presented my case on the matter in the past, and my opinion is the same right now: open up the tutorial section and let it live. If people are concerned with separating good tutorials and everything else, add a second board for those good ones.
[/quote]This too.

Because the tutorial section is not a place to show off your advancements into RSPS, it is a place for you to teach others what you know. Adding a filter only makes it seem as if you are telling people they aren’t good enough to try and help other people. Everyone should be given the opportunity.

Though perhaps a sticky would be better than a new section for good tutorials.

It should not discourage them it should motivate them.

If one gets a tutorial declined they would be more likely to put more effort into the next one they make. As this process continues one of their tutorials might be accepted giving them a good feeling of accomplishment.[/quote]It didn’t work last time; declined tutorials weren’t re-made

Read full topic

The second we started expecting more out of this community, the decreasing amount of contributions we got. I’ve presented my case on the matter in the past, and my opinion is the same right now: open up the tutorial section and let it live. If people are concerned with separating good tutorials and everything else, add a second board for those good ones.

Because the tutorial section is not a place to show off your advancements into RSPS, it is a place for you to teach others what you know. Adding a filter only makes it seem as if you are telling people they aren’t good enough to try and help other people. Everyone should be given the opportunity.

Though perhaps a sticky would be better than a new section for good tutorials.[/quote]

It should not discourage them it should motivate them.

If one gets a tutorial declined they would be more likely to put more effort into the next one they make. As this process continues one of their tutorials might be accepted giving them a good feeling of accomplishment.

item.title: Tutorial Board post-moderation
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Methinks the general point of a tutorial section is being missed. It’s a section of tutoring contributions of all forms. The second we started expecting more out of this community, the decreasing amount of contributions we got. I’ve presented my case on the matter in the past, and my opinion is the same right now: open up the tutorial section and let it live. If people are concerned with separating good tutorials and everything else, add a second board for those good ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Board post-moderation
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:44, topic:366916”][quote author=zoltanman link=topic=463111.msg3389376#msg3389376 date=1288755738]

I’ve sifted through the tutorials as well as every single section in this forum with moderation to an extent, and everyone still complained about garbage within 2 or 3 days. I don’t see why there should be a filter if it’s going to have to be moderated extensively every single day.

Have a qualification test to post tutorials. That way shit won’t be posted, and that means less moderation.
[/quote]What would be qualification? I doubt any member can follow conventions enough to pass a test, and I don’t believe any other qualification can possible be created other than “length” which can easily be evaded. Manually is the only way to qualify a member.[/quote]

Just going over the basics of Java programming would probably be enough. If a member can’t qualify, then that’s just more motivation to actually go out and learn to earn that right to post tutorials. Manually giving the tests would be best.

Read full topic
